messages.title: Our Community is our Strength
messages.content: Labour WILL reduce tuition fees. Labour Leader Ed Miliband announced that a Labour Government will reduce tuition fees by £3,000 by September 2016 and increase free maintenance grants by £400, as every young person deserves the opportunity to access further education. Labour has also pledged to create 80,000 more apprenticeships every year.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will save our NHS, reinvest in the service employing 20,000 more nurses, 8,000 more GPs and 3,000 more midwives.
Labour WILL reduce tuition fees by £3,000 and ensure an extra 80,000 apprenticeships a year.
Labour will build 200,000 homes a year, crack down on rip-off lettings agents and introduce more long term and secure tenancies for private renters.
Labour will extend free childcare to 25 hours per week for working parents and reinvigorate Sure Start.
Labour will increase the minimum wage and ban zero hour contracts, making work pay.

issues.education: Labour will reduce tuition fees and increase free maintenance grants by £400.
issues.health: Labour will save our NHS, reinvest in the service employing 20,000 more nurses, 8,000 more GPs, and 3,000 more midwives.

housing.content: Labour will build 200,000 homes a year and introduce more long term and secure tenancies for private renters.

leaflet.personalStatement: Dawn said 'Young people were betrayed in 2010 and I'm proud to say that a Labour government will reduce tuition fees and give 16 and 17 year-olds the vote.'

quotes.text: Young people were betrayed in 2010 and I'm proud to say that a Labour government will reduce tuition fees and give 16 and 17 year-olds the vote.

images.caption: Dawn Butler - Labour candidate for MP
